description: AABDA, the Association for Biodynamic Agriculture in Argentina, promotes and supports biodynamic farming practices. Founded in the early 1990s, it serves as a hub for training, certification, and community engagement among producers, consumers, and advocates of sustainable agriculture. AABDA emphasizes the importance of ecological balance, resource conservation, and the interconnectedness of farming practices, aiming to enhance the quality of food systems while fostering a deeper understanding of agricultural sustainability.
name: AABDA
